conversation.content: [relieved] God, I can't believe I was right about this. My whole family, they were all ready to wire that money—fifty thousand dollars! [frustrated] And they kept saying "Stop being so negative, stop questioning everything." [pause] Mom actually called me paranoid. [bitter] "Why can't you just trust people for once?" she said. Well, I don't know, maybe because something felt... off? The whole thing with the investment returns being guaranteed, and the guy calling himself a "wealth advisor" but, hmm, couldn't answer basic questions about licenses. [anxious] I kept asking to see documentation and everyone got so annoyed with me. [mocking] "There you go again, always looking for problems." [sigh] But I just—I couldn't shake this feeling, you know? Something about how he kept pushing for immediate transfers. [very sincerely] And thank God I pushed back because Dad finally agreed to wait one day, just one day, to verify. [gasp loudly] That's when we found out the whole company doesn't even exist! [shaky voice] We were literally hours away from losing everything. Mom's retirement, Dad's savings... [pause] Now suddenly I'm the hero. [chuckle] Same skepticism that drives them crazy at every restaurant, every contractor quote, every—well, everything. [warm] But this time? This time it saved us.

subject: The skeptical attitude that annoys everyone just saved your family from a financial scam
